metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1523 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in statusmap.c in statusmap.cgi in Nagios 3.2.3 and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the layer parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icinga - 1.10.3-1
icinga-cgi - 1.10.3-1
icinga-cgi-bin - 1.10.3-1
icinga-common - 1.10.3-1
icinga-core - 1.10.3-1
icinga-idoutils - 1.10.3-1
No subscription required

nagios3 - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-cgi - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-common - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-core - 3.2.3-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icinga package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1').
nagios3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-3').
